channel.title: Runtime Crash
channel.description:
During normal online gameplay; game suddenly (and instantly) closed.
[url='https://www.felixjones.co.uk/BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505163222_1.dmp']BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505163222_1.dmp[/url]
Machine spec not in dump file; * 2x SLI GPU * Intel Core i7 5930k * 64-bit Windows 8.1 * Game installed on SSD
Seemed similar to the Source multi-core crashes, which I get across all my computers for Source engine games with the multi-core rendering option selected.
EDIT: Same crash on non-SSD drive with -threads 2 set (The thread tried to read from or write to a virtual address for which it does not have the appropriate access.)
[url='https://www.felixjones.co.uk/BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505173310_1.dmp']BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505173310_1.dmp[/url]
EDIT2: Same crash on non-SSD without -threads set, the crash happened a lot quicker
[url='https://www.felixjones.co.uk/BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505182056_1.dmp']BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505182056_1.dmp[/url]
EDIT3: So I decided to check if this crash occurs in single-player. I played all the way through to the end of the dam with no crashes at all.

item.title: Runtime Crash
item.dc:creator: BlackRiver
item.description:
Hi, after the last patch my game keeps crashing. I only MP and here are my PC specs:

i7-4702MQ @ 2.20 GHz
8 GB RAM
64-bit Win 7 Ultimate
AMD Radeon HD 8600/8700M / Intel HD Graphics 4600
Installed on SSD

Black Mesa runs on AMD Radeon HD 8600/8700M with FPS between 50 and 200.
crash_bms.exe_20150519113942_1.zip (43 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Runtime Crash
item.dc:creator: Giovanni1
item.description:
Having the same issue, crashing to desktop sometimes. Twice in the same spot today in LambdaBunker.
And it happens more often too, maybe like twice a day.

System Specs:

Intel Core i5-2450M
Nvidea 1.5GB GTX 570M (by MSI)
6GB of RAM
Win 7
crash_bms.exe_20150510192043_1.dmp.txt (343 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Runtime Crash
item.dc:creator: Vectrex
item.description:
I’m also getting this. Played 30 mins of online deathmatch and the game quit without warning twice. Shame as the multiplayer seems fun - although seems to stutter a bit when you die.

I wondered about disabling multi core rendering which is enabled, but it doesn’t seem to let me over-ride it.

AMD FX 6300
Radeon HD7700 1GB
Win 7 64
8 GB RAM

crash_bms.exe_20150506220721_1.dmp.zip (38.7 KB)

Read full topic

item.title: Runtime Crash
item.dc:creator: Xilefian
item.description:
During normal online gameplay; game suddenly (and instantly) closed.

BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505163222_1.dmp

Machine spec not in dump file;

  • 2x SLI GPU
  • Intel Core i7 5930k
  • 64-bit Windows 8.1
  • Game installed on SSD

Seemed similar to the Source multi-core crashes, which I get across all my computers for Source engine games with the multi-core rendering option selected.

EDIT: Same crash on non-SSD drive with -threads 2 set (The thread tried to read from or write to a virtual address for which it does not have the appropriate access.)

BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505173310_1.dmp

EDIT2: Same crash on non-SSD without -threads set, the crash happened a lot quicker

BMS/crash_bms.exe_20150505182056_1.dmp

EDIT3: So I decided to check if this crash occurs in single-player. I played all the way through to the end of the dam with no crashes at all.

Read full topic
